data.title: 100+ Best Clean TV Shows That Are Family-Friendly (2024)
data.meta_description: Check out these clean TV shows. There are shows recommended for every age, Christian streaming services, profanity filters, and free apps, including The Chosen.
data.meta_site_name: Mom Remade | Christian Family Living with a Touch of Humor
data.text:
Are you searching for the best clean TV shows available right now? I was a little skeptical when I started looking for shows to recommend. I didn’t think I would find fifty clean, family-friendly TV shows worth watching.

Let’s face it: there’s a lot of trash out there, especially on network television.

Fortunately, I decided to ask people on my personal Facebook page, Mom Remade, and my Christian Family Living Group to tell me about their favorite clean TV shows for the family. I also asked a few Christian parenting and family groups.

And, boy, did they deliver! There are plenty of options that cater to audiences seeking clean, family-friendly, wholesome entertainment.

I have spent hours compiling these recommendations so you would have a quick reference for some good, clean TV shows, plus information on profanity filters and Christian streaming services.

I am constantly updating this list to serve your family best, so send me your recommendations! There are now over 100+ shows for you to check out!

RELATED:100+ Best Christian Family Movies of All Time (2024)

100+ Best Clean TV Shows That Are Family-Friendly (2024)

Check out these clean TV shows on Amazon, Netflix, and other streaming services. These shows can be found on many channels, Christian or secular.

Best Clean TV Shows-Old School (Classics)

Here are some great classic shows for the whole family. These wholesome TV shows from the past will make you nostalgic for the good ol’ days. Thankfully, we can still enjoy them now.

The Andy Griffith Show

The Waltons

The Beverly Hillbillies

Leave It to Beaver

Clean TV Shows On Hallmark

Hallmark has many clean TV shows to watch together as a family. These feel-good shows will keep you entertained for hours and warm your heart.

Clean TV Shows For Adults on Network Television (2024)

Check out these clean TV shows for adults on network television. If you have more suggestions, please add them to the comments below. Sadly, I struggled to find many family-friendly shows on traditional network stations.

Bluebloods (violence)

NCIS (violence)

American Idol

The Voice

The Amazing Race

American Ninja Warrior

America’s Got Talent

The Best Home Reno Shows to Watch (2024)

Luckily, making a home reno show trashy is hard, so anything on Magnolia Network or HGTV will be clean programming. Magnolia Network is owned by Chuck and Joanna Gaines, who are upstanding people, so I know whatever they produce will be high quality.

Listed are the most popular home reno TV shows. Do you have a favorite?

Love It or List It

Home Town

Farm House Fixer

Christina on the Coast

Restored by the Fords

Rock the Block

First-Time Fixer

Celebrity IOU

Van Go

Property Brothers

Fixer Upper

Flip or Flop

This Old House

Clean (or mostly clean) TV Series On PBS, PBS Passport, Amazon PBS Masterpiece, BBC, or Britbox

Our friends on the other side of the pond (Britain) have good taste in TV programs. Some of these shows are a little racy but not as much as American network programming. You still need to be on the lookout for junk because they slip it in occasionally.

These shows are for more adult audiences because they are period dramas, but older teens may find them enjoyable. As a bonus, many of these shows hop around on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, Apple +, Roku, YouTube, or other streaming sites.

I promise you will be addicted once you start watching!

Father Brown

Victoria

Pride and Prejudice

Mr. Selfridge

Bleak House

Poldark (borderline but it’s good)

Downton Abbey (Soooo good!)

Call the Midwife

Sister Boniface Mysteries

Antiques Roadshow

Rick Steves’ Europe

Lark Rise to Candleford

Endeavour

Poirot

Sherlock

Atlantic Crossing

Around the World in 80 Days

The Paradise

Sanditon

Cranford

Upstairs, Downstairs

Miss Scarlet and the Duke (violence)

Little Women

All Creatures Great and Small (Sooo good!)

Chosen App/ YouTube

This is my FAVORITE series. It is sooo good. You must download The Chosen app and watch it on your phone or screen mirror it on your television.

You can also get it on YouTube or BYUtv. (Who knows when they will flag it and remove it from YouTube?) The Chosen is not inappropriate in any way; it is the Bible in living color. (There are a few unbiblical accounts.)

Dallas Jenkins (son of Jerry B. Jenkins, Left Behind Series) has gone to great lengths to ensure it is scriptural. For your information, start with Season 1, Episode 3, and then return to Episode 1. Episodes 1 and 2 will make more sense and not feel as slow.

The Chosen

Is There a Christian Streaming Service?

Check out these alternative Christian streaming services, such as Netflix. They offer Christian-themed movies, clean TV shows, documentaries, Christian comedy, and children’s programming.

They all vary in cost and payment plans. Check out their websites for more information.

Hallmark Channel

This was my favorite channel, but they have strayed from traditional values. I still watch it, but I must be more vigilant about what comes across the screen.

Angel Studios

Angel Studios offers an extensive library of free, family-friendly streaming content, including its most famous show, The Chosen. There are also movies, documentaries, Christian comedies, and cartoons for kids.

While it’s free, by “paying it forward,” you keep the content free for other viewers.

BYUtv

BYUtv is another free streaming service. Download the app, watch it on Frndly, or go to byutv.org. You must have Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, Chromecast, Roku, Android TV, Windows, Xbox One, iOS, or an Android.

There are lots of shows. I just found The Chosen on there. Yay!

PureFlix/Great American

PureFlix/Great American subscription service offers Christian movies, shows, comedy series, and children’s programming. This is the best Christian streaming app, in my opinion. The quality is superb. They own their studio, so they produce many of their programs.

Christian Cinema

This is a no-commitment, no-subscription platform. You pay as you go. They offer faith-based content as well as mainstream media. The movie selections look similar to what is provided on PureFlix. There is programming for both kids and adults.

Frndly TV

Frndly TV is a subscription service that offers many channels with the choice of live TV, and On Demand. You can also record a bunch of shows. There are no contracts, and you can cancel at any time.

They have three Hallmark channels, UP TV, BYU, Great American, Ion, and Insp. They also have unlimited DVR. I have this service and love it!

Dove Channel

The Dove Channel offers old classics as well as new content. Some of it is free, but you must pay for the good stuff. There is both mainstream content for adults and children.

Up Faith & Family

Up is an uplifting faith and family paid streaming service, just like it says. It is included on the Frdly app if you don’t want to stream it alone. There are TV series, movies, and kids programming. Many familiar titles are offered.

CrossFlix+

CrossFlix+ is an inexpensive streaming platform that offers faith-based, family-friendly movies and children’s programming. It also allows churches to stream their services.

Their goal is to entertain and educate. They are available on Roku.

FaithLifeTV

FaithLife TV offers movies, documentaries, and children’s programming and constantly adds more. It has three tiers: free, pay-as-you-go, and subscription service.

Tween Xstream

Tween Xstream is a Christian streaming platform for tweens. It was recommended on a Christian parenting site I am on. It just started in September 2020.

It’s a streaming service from South Africa, so don’t be surprised when you see the cost on your bill; it will be in South African Rand (ZAR).

Yippee

Yipee is like Netflix, but for kids. It’s a subscription service that is slightly cheaper than Minno. They have many VeggieTales, YouTube-style videos, cartoons, Backyard Bible Camp, and other choices. I’m hearing good things from parents about this one.

Smile of a Child

This 24-hour Christian children’s network offers animated and live-action faith-based programming for kids. Jay-Jay the Jet Plane, Veggie Tales, and other well-known programs are offered.

You can get it through Verizon, Roku, AT&T, Glorystar, TBN, or their website.

Right Now Media Kids

Right now, media caters to adults and children. It is a free service offered through many churches. Ask your church for a special link to access your account.

Veggie Tales, Superbook, and the StoryKeepers are just a few of their offerings. Their catalog is impressive and worth checking out.

Minno Kids

This is a Christian subscription streaming platform for young kids. They have 50+ episodes of just VeggieTales. They also offer Superbook, Owlegories, and much more. There are 140+ shows in all. It’s available on Apple, Google, Roku, and Amazon and can be accessed on your phone, tablet, TV, or computer.

Answers.TV

Answers.TV offers live streaming and on-demand video content, including nature shows, adventure programs, family-friendly educational videos, and science content based on a biblical worldview.

This streaming service partners with well-known programs such as the Creation Museum, Ark Encounter, and Answers in Genesis.

Best Deals on Streaming Services

Dish Network

Sign up for the basic package, including locals, some news, Hallmark, HGTV, and a few other channels. You must talk to a Dish representative to get the basic package, especially if you are not a new customer. It is available. Push until you get it!

YouTube TV

YouTube TV gives you locals, sports channels, news channels, Ion, Hallmark, the Dove Channel, and HGTV, among other things. This may be the way to go if you like sports and clean TV shows.

Stream channels without cable /dish service

If you have an Apple box, you can stream whatever you want. Choose the channels you like without anyone forcing you to add channels you don’t need or want. You can finally have it your way!

Spectrum

Spectrum has different plans that offer local channels for a meager price. If that is all you want, it will get you the news and a few movies. It is great as a base if you are adding streaming services.

RELATED: Family Bonding Activities: Fun Ways to Spend Time Together

Get your FREE FAMILY SCHEDULE PRINTABLE and editable document. Make time for what is important!

Best Profanity Filters For TV

After much reading and research, I found these services to be the most optimal for families. They all have their pros and cons. It just depends on what services you are currently using and how they will specifically work for you.

Check out all of them periodically because they are constantly upgrading and changing what they can do. Prices change depending on the type of service you get.

VidAngel– there are three ways to use the filters. You can skip nasty scenes that include violence, block nudity, and mute words you don’t want to hear. It works with streaming services like Netflix, Amazon, Amazon Prime, and HBO.

TVGuardian: works with standard definition and high definition TVs. It works anywhere with closed captioning, such as Dish Network, cable, DVRs, TV antennas, satellite, DVD, and Blu-ray players. It will not work on streaming services, computers, or game systems.

ClearPlay– they offer an app that works with streaming services that are purchased or rented. You can automatically skip over scenes and language you do not want to hear or see. It works with Netflix, Amazon, and Blu-ray discs.

Controls on your TV—Check the manufacturer’s instructions for the filters on your TV. All smart TVs have a parental control option. Many streaming services allow you to create a dedicated profile for your children and adjust the parental controls as needed.

What Sites Can You Watch TV For Free?

Freevee is a premium, free TV streaming service. You can download the Freevee app to enjoy thousands of movies, shows, and Freevee originals. It is free because it has commercials, so beware!

Another free channel is KERA (PBS). Most people get this channel through their local programming. Sadly, you have to watch out for some of their programming. The shows are good, but they slip in a few immoral things here and there.

Downton Abbey, Upstairs Downstairs, and The World on Fire are just a few of the shows from the Masterpiece series. PBS isn’t just for little kids. It’s for big kids too! Check it out.

RELATED: Family Schedule: How to Keep Your Sanity When the Kids Are Home

Pin it for later!

Finding Family-Friendly TV Shows

If your family is stuck at home more than usual, these shows will keep them entertained for a long time.

I highly recommend doing other things besides watching TV, but sometimes it is nice to sit down and chill.

You can watch these clean TV shows when you are together as a family. It will make it much easier not to constantly change the channel or start over with something else.

What clean TV shows do you recommend? Comment below. Also, let me know if these shows are not what they claim to be.

Got Family Problems? There is Help and Hope!

Are you experiencing family problems or have a family estrangement? Do you feel shame, anger, or rejection? Check out my book Estranged: Finding Hope When Your Family Falls Apart on Amazon or at your favorite digital store.

This book not only talks about my seven-year estrangement from my Christian family but also gives solid tips to help you with your family problems. Break free from your pain. Allow God to heal you no matter what has happened in your family of origin. There is hope when your family falls apart.

Creating Family Memories Book

Get Creating Family Memories. This book will help you manage your family in a way that allows more time to be intentional with your kids. It includes a schedule too. You can get it at your favorite bookstore.

Join the group Christian Family Living on Facebook

Continue the conversation on Facebook and join the group Christian Family Living. This is a place for Christian women to freely talk about parenting, marriage, faith, family, and culture. Being a Christian is hard! Let’s do it together. Most of all, a sense of humor is required. Got memes? Bring it on!

Follow Me on Pinterest!

There are tips on building a Christian home, parenting, marriage, family issues, and faith. Learn how to get back to the things that matter most in your life and the life of your family. It’s time for a revival!
